title: Photo Mosaic with White House Social Media Images
description: In this coding challenge, I use a collection of Obama Administration’s facebook images to create a “photo mosaic” of President Obama with Processing (Java).

timestamps.title: Introduce the coding challenge
Mention the 'White House Social Media Data Visualization' coding challenge
Introduce the dataset
Explain the goal of the coding challenge
Set up a Processing project
Draw an image
Explain how to pixelate the image
Copy the image at a smaller scale
Loop through the pixels of the smaller image
Consider the color of each pixel
Draw a larger rectangle with the same color
List files from a local directory
Filter files to consider only images
Load all images
Test code with a subset of images
Consider the brightness of the pixels instead of color
Explain the logic behind the mosaic
Consider the brightness of the images
Create an array of brightness values
Compute the average brightness of each image
Store the average brightness
Create an array of possible brightness values
Associate values to the image with the closest average brightness
Draw images instead of rectangles
Test code
Explain `OutOfMemoryError`
Sample images down
Suggest improvements and creative possibilities
Conclude the coding challenge

codeExamples.title: Photo Mosaic with White House Social Media Images
codeExamples.description: This Processing project uses a collection of Obama Administration's facebook images to create a mosaic of President Obama.

links.title: 10.4: Pixels! (The Pixels Array) - Processing Tutorial
links.description: This video covers the basics of reading from and writing to the pixels array in Processing / Java. This is foundation for all image processing and computer vision applications and examples I'll show in the rest of image and video in Processing (Java) videos.
